docs.lead_paragraph: Almost two years after losing his firstborn to an illness, pitcher Pat Neshek, 33, won a roster spot with St. Louis, became a father again and, finally, a first-time All-Star.

headline.seo: Cardinals Marvel at Pat Neshek’s Comeback
headline.main: Cardinal Reliever’s Tumultuous Road Leads to an All-Star Ending
headline.print_headline: Cardinal Reliever’s Tumultuous Road Leads to an All-Star Ending

docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals relief pitcher Pat Neshek has, nearly two years after losing his firstborn son to unexplained illness, won roster spot with St Louis and become father again, as well as first time All-Star.
docs.snippet: Almost two years after losing his firstborn to an illness, pitcher Pat Neshek, 33, won a roster spot with St. Louis, became a father again and, finally, a first-time All-Star.

headline.main: The Gay Mormon Known Sperm Donor From Utah

docs.abstract: My friends used to offer up my status as a gay former Mormon as an icebreaker. Now, they’re helpfully tossing my role as “known sperm donor” out at dinner parties.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant women have new protections against on-the-job discrimination.

headline.main: Agency Toughens Protections for Pregnant Workers
headline.print_headline: Agency Toughens Protections for Pregnant Workers

docs.snippet: Pregnant women have new protections against on-the-job discrimination.

docs.lead_paragraph: New guidelines emphasize that employers cannot discriminate against workers because of past, present or future pregnancies.

headline.main: Equal Opportunity Employment Officials Take New Aim at Pregnancy Bias
headline.print_headline: Equal Opportunity Employment Officials Take New Aim at Pregnancy Bias

docs.abstract: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission issues new guidelines emphasizing that employers cannot discriminate against workers because of past, present or future pregnancies.
docs.snippet: New guidelines emphasize that employers cannot discriminate against workers because of past, present or future pregnancies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Given the placenta’s vital role, and all that can go wrong in pregnancy, relatively little is known about the organ, but that makes it fertile territory for potential medical breakthroughs.

headline.seo: The Push to Understand the Placenta
headline.main: The Mysterious Tree of a Newborn’s Life
headline.print_headline: The Mysterious Tree of a Newborn’s Life

docs.abstract: Scientists are undertaking intense study of placenta, disk of tissue that serves as life-support for developing fetus and about which fairly little is known; some have begun to suspect that placenta may not be sterile, as previously thought, but may contain microbiome that helps shape immune system and health of fetus.
docs.snippet: Given the placenta’s vital role, and all that can go wrong in pregnancy, relatively little is known about the organ, but that makes it fertile territory for potential medical breakthroughs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The free-standing emergency room, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, is part of a trend that provides acute care but also helps a hospital’s bottom line.

headline.main: An E.R., Not a Hospital, Is Set to Open at St. Vincent’s Site
headline.print_headline: E.R., Not a Hospital, Is Set to Open at St. Vincent’s Site

docs.abstract: North Shore-Long Island Jewish Health System is opening free-standing emergency room in building that was once part of St Vincent's Hospital in West Village; ER, to be called Lenox Hill HealthPlex to denote its relationship with North Shore's hospital on the Upper East Side, is part of growing trend across country and has as much to do with a hospital's bottom line as providing acute care.
docs.snippet: The free-standing emergency room, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, is part of a trend that provides acute care but also helps a hospital’s bottom line.
